page_analysis.text_content:
2nd & 3rd floor equivalency

Areas higher than 17' and 26' above the first floor (that do not already count as floor area e.g., open atrium spaces and inaccessible attic spaces), count toward the gross floor area in the form of 2nd and 3rd floor equivalency regardless of the floor plan or usage of the space. Stairwells will be measured the same way that vaulted ceiling spaces are measured.

In the examples of Fig 12 below the highlighted areas count as follows:

Area A
• once as 1st floor,
• again as 2nd floor, and
• a third time as 3rd-floor equivalency

Area B
• once as 1st floor,
• again as 2nd-floor equivalency

Note: 200 sf of 3rd floor equivalency may be exempted where roof pitch is 4:12 or steeper (see "Height" section).

Fig 12 2nd & 3rd floor equivalency

visual_elements.description: Two cross-sectional building diagrams showing floor equivalency measurements. Both diagrams show buildings with sloped roofs, labeled areas A and B, and measurement lines indicating heights of 17' and 26' above the first floor. The left diagram shows a simpler structure, while the right diagram includes a vaulted ceiling space. Both diagrams have hatched areas indicating different floor equivalency zones and arrows showing width measurements.
Gray text box containing a note about 200 sf exemption for 3rd floor equivalency when roof pitch is 4:12 or steeper

additional_notes: Page number 17 appears at bottom right
Figure contains detailed architectural cross-sections with hatched areas indicating different equivalency zones

qualifiers.text: that do not already count as floor area e.g., open atrium spaces and inaccessible attic spaces
regardless of the floor plan or usage of the space
where roof pitch is 4:12 or steeper

conditions.text: Areas higher than 17' above the first floor
Areas higher than 26' above the first floor
200 sf of 3rd floor equivalency may be exempted

logical_relationships.expression: Areas higher than 17' and 26' above the first floor (that do not already count as floor area e.g., open atrium spaces and inaccessible attic spaces), count toward the gross floor area in the form of 2nd and 3rd floor equivalency regardless of the floor plan or usage of the space
200 sf of 3rd floor equivalency may be exempted where roof pitch is 4:12 or steeper

execution_sequence.action: Identify areas higher than 17' above first floor that do not already count as floor area
Count qualifying areas as 2nd floor equivalency regardless of floor plan or usage
Identify areas higher than 26' above first floor that do not already count as floor area
Count qualifying areas as 3rd floor equivalency regardless of floor plan or usage
Apply exemption of up to 200 sf of 3rd floor equivalency if roof pitch qualifies
